content.title: Andaman & Nicobar Bed & Breakfast / Home Stay Establishment Scheme
content.department: Directorate of Tourism, Andaman & Nicobar Administration
content.details: The Directorate of Tourism, Andaman & Nicobar Administration, is implementing the ‘Andaman & Nicobar Bed & Breakfast/Homestay Scheme’ all over the Island based on the approved guidelines of the Ministry of Tourism, Govt. of India, under the scheme “Incredible India Bed & Breakfast/Homestay Establishment”. The concept of the scheme is to provide supplementary and quality accommodation for foreigners and domestic tourists to stay with an Indian family to experience Indian customs and traditions.
benefits: The scheme will be on a bed-and-breakfast basis, and charges will have to be levied accordingly.
Once an establishment applies for classification or reclassification, it will have to be ready at all times for inspection by the Classification Committee.
Classification will be valid for three years from the date of issue of orders.
The application fee payable for classification or reclassification of a B&B or homestay will be as follows: Silver Star Category: ₹ 1000/-; Gold Star Category: ₹ 2000/-.
eligibility: The owner/promoter of the establishment, along with his/her family, must physically reside in the same establishment.
A minimum of one room and a maximum of six rooms (12 beds) must be let out.
content.application_process: Online and In-Person. To get a Homestay Licence, the applicant has to approach the Ministry of Tourism regional office. An application form will be provided or can be downloaded. The applicant must fill in all necessary details and attach required documents.
documents_required: No Documents required for this Scheme

faqs.question: What documents are required for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No documents are required for this scheme.
